description: Add visual maintenance status indicators to tool cards in the skills directory web UI

File containing tool card component is identified and path logged to notes

tasks.notes:

Tool card component: web/src/components/tools/ToolCard.tsx

tasks.title: Create maintenance status utility function file
tasks.description: Create a new utility file with a function that categorizes tools by last commit date into status levels.
acceptanceCriteria: Create file `utils/maintenanceStatus.ts` or similar in web UI directory
Function accepts lastCommitDate parameter (Date, string, or null)
Function returns object with status ('Active'|'Maintained'|'Stale'|'Inactive'|'Unknown') and color
Thresholds: Active <30d, Maintained 30-90d, Stale 90-180d, Inactive >180d, Unknown for null
Run `npm run typecheck` - exits with code 0
tasks.notes:
Created web/src/utils/maintenanceStatus.ts
Function: getMaintenanceStatus(lastCommitDate: Date | string | null)
Returns: { status: MaintenanceStatus, color: string }
Thresholds implemented: Active <30d, Maintained 30-90d, Stale 90-180d, Inactive >180d
Color codes: Active=#22c55e (green), Maintained=#eab308 (yellow), Stale=#f97316 (orange), Inactive=#ef4444 (red), Unknown=#6b7280 (gray)
Handles null/undefined and invalid dates by returning Unknown status
npm run build passes with exit code 0

tasks.title: Add unit tests for status calculation edge cases
tasks.description: Test the maintenance status function with various date inputs including edge cases.
acceptanceCriteria: Test with date 15 days ago - returns status='Active' and green color
Test with date 60 days ago - returns status='Maintained' and yellow color
Test with date 120 days ago - returns status='Stale' and orange color
Test with date 200 days ago - returns status='Inactive' and red color
Test with null date - returns status='Unknown' and gray color
Run `npm test` - all tests pass with exit code 0
tasks.notes:
Installed Vitest testing framework with happy-dom environment
Created web/vitest.config.ts configuration file
Created web/src/utils/maintenanceStatus.test.ts with 17 comprehensive tests
Tests cover all edge cases: Active (15d, 1d, 29d), Maintained (60d, 30d, 89d), Stale (120d, 90d, 179d), Inactive (200d, 180d, 365d), Unknown (null, undefined, invalid)
Added npm test and test:watch scripts to package.json
All tests pass with exit code 0
Fixed pre-existing ESLint error in SearchResults.tsx (unescaped quotes)
Both quality checks pass: npm run lint and npm run build
